1.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be (causatively, make) zealous, i.e. (in a bad sense) jealous or envious
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

3.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

4.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
delightful (objective or subjective, literal or figurative)

5.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
(only in plural) properly, steerage (as a management of ropes), i.e. (figuratively) guidance or (by implication) a plan
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)
rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve

7.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
an opening, i.e. door or gate
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

8.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

9.brief: a plan, especially a bad one
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede

10.brief: to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

11.brief: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to balance, i.e. measure out (by weight or dimension); figuratively, arrange, equalize, through the idea of levelling (ment. estimate, test)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

13.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
honey (from its stickiness); by analogy, syrup
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a dripping i.e. of honey (from the comb)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

14.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
(adjectively) at home; hence (by implication of satisfaction) lovely; also (noun) a home, of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals (den)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
a couch or place of repose

16.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

23.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
